required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tripeptide/Hexapeptide Topical and Hybrid Laser Treatment for Acne Scarring
clinical_study.official_title: A Single Center, Prospective, Blinded Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of a Tripeptide/Hexapeptide Topical When Used With Er:YAG Hybrid Laser for the Treatment of Acne Scars

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the efficacy of a tripeptide/hexapeptide topical (Alastin Regenerating Skin Nectar with TriHex TechnologyÂ®) in wound healing and scar reduction following Erbium:YAG hybrid resurfacing laser for acne scarring compared to the standard of post-procedure care consisting of a bland moisturizer.

primary_outcome.description: A colorimeter will be used to measure the erythema index. The range of the index is 0 to X with 0 indicating better outcome. Erythema will be measured at days of laser treatment and 4 days after treatment. Laser treatment will occur at baseline and day 30. The mean change for each laser treatment will be averaged to get the overall mean for each arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change in skin barrier function
secondary_outcome.description: Barrier function will be measured by transepidermal water loss in grams/m2(hour). The lower the water loss the better the barrier function of the skin. Barrier function will be measured at days of laser treatment and 4 days after treatment. Laser treatment will occur at baseline and day 30. The mean change for each laser treatment will be averaged to get the overall mean for each arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change in Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale
secondary_outcome.description: The Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale ranges from 1 to 5 with lower numbers indicating better outcomes. (1 = very much improved,2 = marked improvement, 3 = improved, 4 = no change, 5 = worse)

clinical_study.condition: Acne Scars - Mixed Atrophic and Hypertrophic

intervention.description: two treatments given one month apart

intervention.intervention_name: Alastin Regenerating Skin Nectar with TriHex Technology

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- male or females
- age 18 and older
- with evidence of grade II-III acne scars on the face (mild to moderate) as determined by the Goodman & Baron qualitative global acne scar grading system
Exclusion Criteria:
- treatment to face with any energy device within 6 months
- tanning within 7 days
- dermabrasion or chemical peel within 3 months
- current use of systemic retinoids
- keloidal scaring in the treatment area
- use of systemic steroids within 6 months
- use of topical products with retinoid, alpha-hydroxyacid, salicylic acid, vitamin C or E within 14 days
